part_a_stress_test.description: Cycle 6 top 20 models scored under 3 alternative weight vectors to test robustness of architecture ranking

axis_raw_scores_top_20._note: Raw scores per axis (0-100 scale) used for reweighting. These are the UNDERLYING scores before weighting.

robust_top_10_all_vectors.note: Top 7 in ALL vectors. Compounding + convergence both strong.
Top 8 in ALL vectors. Convergence-dominant BEST for this model.
Top 6 in ALL vectors. Force-dominant BEST (#1). Convergence-dominant WORST.
Remarkably stable across all vectors. Balanced high scores.
Top 10 in ALL vectors. Convergence pushes it up.
Top 10 in ALL vectors. Force + compounding best for it.
Top 9 in ALL. Balanced but slightly volatile.

weight_sensitive_models.note: Top 2 under force-dominant, drops to 10 under compounding-dominant. FORCE-DEPENDENT.
Top 3 under compounding-dominant, drops to 12+ under force-dominant. COMPOUNDING-DEPENDENT.
Timing-dependent. Strong only with sufficient timing weight. Time-limited opportunity.
Force-dependent. Only enters top 10 under force-dominant weights.

architecture_dominance_test.question: Does physical > digital hold across all weight vectors?
architecture_dominance_test.answer: PARTIALLY. Physical architectures dominate under CONVERGENCE-dominant and COMPOUNDING-dominant weights (convergence resistance from physical assets; compounding from rollup scale). Under FORCE-dominant weights, DATA COMPOUNDING (digital) takes #1 position because the TAM and cost advantage of digital services is larger. The conclusion: physical architectures are structurally MORE DURABLE but digital data compounding captures MORE ECONOMIC FORCE. Strategy implication: build physical for durability, build digital in parallel for scale.

part_b_force_architecture_matrix.description: 8 forces x 10 architectures = 80 cells. Each cell shows cycle 6 model count and cycle 7 status.

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Inference cost collapse doesn't create acquisition targets; it creates cost advantages for new builds

full_service_replacement.reason: Core force driving FSR architecture -- lower inference = cheaper full-service delivery

platform_infrastructure.reason: AI deployment platforms benefit from falling costs

vertical_saas.reason: Many models exist but score 67 avg due to commoditization risk

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: AI compliance tools benefit from falling inference cost -- can monitor more at lower cost

data_compounding.reason: Core pattern: service generates data, data generates moat

physical_production_ai.reason: Cheaper AI inference helps physical production optimization

rollup_consolidation.reason: AI-native consolidation of fragmented service industries (using cost advantage as rollup fuel)

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Acquire Baumol-afflicted practices (accounting, dental, vet) and modernize with AI. NAICS data reveals many more targets.

full_service_replacement.reason: Largest cell. Replace expensive human functions with AI at 10x lower cost.

platform_infrastructure.reason: Platforms serving Baumol-cured professionals (AI design tools, AI code tools, AI consulting frameworks)

vertical_saas.reason: Many tools exist but score low due to platform commoditization

marketplace_network.reason: Marketplaces connecting AI-augmented professionals to clients

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: Compliance complexity in Baumol sectors = moat

data_compounding.reason: Service entry in Baumol sectors generates proprietary data

physical_production_ai.reason: Baumol cure primarily affects cognitive/admin services, not physical production

rollup_consolidation.reason: Consolidate fragmented Baumol practices (accounting firms, dental offices, vet practices, PT clinics)

arbitrage_window.reason: Acquire PE-distressed Baumol practices during debt maturity wall

acquire_and_modernize.reason: THE core cell. NAICS data reveals 10+ new sectors with retiring owners beyond CNC and food.

full_service_replacement.reason: Replace retiring practitioners entirely with AI service

platform_infrastructure.reason: Platforms for AI-modernized acquired businesses (shared ERP, scheduling, etc.)

vertical_saas.reason: Tools for businesses in succession transition

marketplace_network.reason: Business acquisition marketplaces (BizBuySell enhancement, AI matching)

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: Transfer of regulatory licenses during acquisition creates compliance moat

data_compounding.reason: Aggregated operational data across acquired businesses

physical_production_ai.reason: Greenfield alternative to acquisition in manufacturing

rollup_consolidation.reason: Multi-site rollup of retiring-owner businesses. NAICS data shows printing, furniture, plastics, metal fab all have fragmented ownership.

arbitrage_window.reason: Time-limited demographic window for below-market acquisitions

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Acquire + deploy cobots. NAICS adds: plastics, printing, metal fab, bakery, furniture, auto parts.

full_service_replacement.reason: Contract manufacturing as full-service: customer sends design, AI+robotics facility produces

platform_infrastructure.reason: AI manufacturing deployment platform, MES, scheduling optimization

marketplace_network.reason: Manufacturing capacity marketplace (match buyers to AI-enabled shops)

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: FDA/USDA/OSHA compliance in manufacturing creates regulatory moats

data_compounding.reason: Process optimization data across multiple production facilities

physical_production_ai.reason: Greenfield AI-native production. NAICS adds: HVAC equipment for data centers, medical devices, confectionery

rollup_consolidation.reason: Multi-facility production platform. NAICS adds: printing, plastics, furniture rollups.

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Acquire regulated businesses (licensed practices, permitted facilities) for regulatory moat

full_service_replacement.reason: Full-service compliance management replacing in-house teams

marketplace_network.reason: Marketplace for compliance professionals, licensed practitioners

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: THE core cell. NAICS reveals: veterinary regulation, child care licensing, construction permitting, financial compliance.

data_compounding.reason: Compliance data across jurisdictions = compounding moat

physical_production_ai.reason: Regulatory fragmentation primarily affects services, not physical production methods

rollup_consolidation.reason: Consolidate licensed/regulated businesses across fragmented regulatory environments

arbitrage_window.reason: First-mover window before regulatory landscape settles

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Acquire PE-distressed businesses. NAICS data reveals: vet practices, dental DSOs, staffing agencies, printing companies.

full_service_replacement.reason: Replace PE-bloated operations with lean AI service

platform_infrastructure.reason: Platform for managing acquired PE-distressed assets

vertical_saas.reason: PE distress creates acquisition targets, not SaaS opportunities

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: PE distress is a cyclical force, not a regulatory one

data_compounding.reason: Due diligence data from evaluating distressed assets

physical_production_ai.reason: PE-distressed manufacturers available for AI modernization

rollup_consolidation.reason: Counter-rollup: acquire distressed PE portfolio companies at discount

arbitrage_window.reason: THE core cell. $1.2T maturity wall 2027-2029. NAICS adds: veterinary, staffing, dental, printing.

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Coasean shrinkage creates small firms, not acquisition targets

full_service_replacement.reason: Full-service for micro-firms (finance, HR, legal) that used to be departments

regulatory_moat_builder.reason: Compliance-as-a-service for micro-firms navigating regulation alone

physical_production_ai.reason: Coasean shrinkage is about coordination costs, not production

rollup_consolidation.reason: Contradicts the shrinkage direction -- firms are getting smaller, not consolidating

arbitrage_window.reason: Coasean shrinkage is a secular trend, not a time-limited window

acquire_and_modernize.reason: Deployment phase creates new builds, not acquisition targets

platform_infrastructure.reason: THE core cell. Application-layer platforms that capture value as infrastructure commoditizes.

vertical_saas.reason: Vertical applications built on commodity infrastructure

data_compounding.reason: Application-layer data moats built on commodity infrastructure

physical_production_ai.reason: Physical production using deployment-phase AI (mature models, proven infrastructure)

rollup_consolidation.reason: Consolidate early application-layer companies as deployment matures

arbitrage_window.reason: Installation-to-deployment transition window for capturing value

matrix_summary.key_finding: 16 of 80 cells (20%) are structurally impossible. 12 cells (15%) were unexplored but promising -- cycle 7 adds models to all 12. The remaining 52 cells range from partially to well-mapped. The matrix reveals that BAUMOL CURE and SILVER TSUNAMI forces produce models in the most architecture types (8 of 10 each), while COASEAN SHRINKAGE and KONDRATIEFF DEPLOYMENT are more architecturally constrained (5-6 of 10).

top_naics_discoveries.title: Printing
top_naics_discoveries.why: 28K establishments, declining emp, 85% say AI critical -- HIGHEST fragmentation in manufacturing, totally unexplored

top_naics_discoveries.title: Building equipment contractors
top_naics_discoveries.why: 2.46M employees, 70% can't find workers, $190B wages -- MASSIVE sector, AI-augmented trades

top_naics_discoveries.title: Employment services
top_naics_discoveries.why: 3.57M employees but DECLINING 7.6% -- active cascade in staffing industry

top_naics_discoveries.title: Credit intermediation support
top_naics_discoveries.why: Emp -10.7% wage +13.8% = textbook Schumpeterian gap signal

top_naics_discoveries.title: Allied health practitioners
top_naics_discoveries.why: 191K establishments, most fragmented healthcare sector, largely underserved by healthcare IT

top_naics_discoveries.title: Plastics products
top_naics_discoveries.why: 600K employees, 12K establishments, high automation potential with robotic injection molding

top_naics_discoveries.title: Furniture manufacturing
top_naics_discoveries.why: 12,767 establishments, kitchen cabinets = custom CNC, many retiring owners

top_naics_discoveries.title: Individual/family services
top_naics_discoveries.why: 981K establishments -- most fragmented major industry, platform infrastructure opportunity
